snippet.title: Report looks at whether millennial moms are more traditional, happier
snippet.description:
* I'm a Generation X mom who works outside the home, and I've always felt strongly that women who have a choice about whether to work or stay home after having children should feel completely comfortable with either decision.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/04/living/millennial-moms-new-report-parents/index.html

snippet.title: This is your brain on knitting
snippet.description:
* Her brother's sudden death in 2004 hit Sarah Huerta hard.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/25/health/brain-crafting-benefits/index.html

snippet.title: Plugging China's talent pool
snippet.description:
* "Culture is not the main reason why most Chinese people leave. This is a romantic view. Most people leave China because of practical reasons like education, food and wealth security and air quality."
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/20/world/asia/china-brain-drain/index.html

snippet.title: The women you don't know -- yet
snippet.description:
* Did you know that the "frequency hopping" technology that is vital to much of our military technology and helps keep your cell phone and your GPS devices secure was developed and patented by a famous movie star?
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/03/opinion/maloney-national-womens-month/index.html

snippet.title: Steven Pinker: 'We don't throw virgins into volcanoes any more'
snippet.description:
* In the week that I interview the cognitive psychologist and bestselling author Steven Pinker in his office at Harvard, police release the agonizing recordings of emergency calls made during the Sandy Hook school shootings. In Yemen, a suicide attack on the defense ministry kills more than 50 people. An American teacher is shot dead as he goes joggi...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/05/world/steven-pinker-interview/index.html

snippet.title: Students, say goodbye to snow days -- and say hello to school at home
snippet.description:
* Earlier this month, Zak Terzini roused himself about five minutes before his English class began and didn't panic. Instead, the high school sophomore grabbed his iPod and checked on a class discussion of "The Autobiography of Malcolm X" without even getting out of bed.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/02/23/living/snow-days-virtual-schools/index.html

snippet.title: Survey charts cell phone use during U.S. elections
snippet.description:
* Just over a quarter of all American adults used cell phones to participate in some election-related activity during last month's elections, according to a new report from the Pew Internet and American Life Project.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/TECH/mobile/12/27/survey.phones.election/index.html

snippet.title: Asiaweek
snippet.description:
* HONG KONGERS DONT JUST TRAVEL TO MAINLAND CHINA for business or tourism. Many of them go there to indulge in an activity outlawed in Hong Kong eating exotic or endangered species of animals. A survey conducted by Traffic, a wildlife watchdog group, has found that 36.3 of respondents had eaten sn...
http://www.cnn.com/ASIANOW/asiaweek/98/1211/newsmap/china.html

snippet.title: Survey estimates 1 percent of adults have active epilepsy
snippet.description:
* An estimated one percent of adults have active epilepsy, and many of them are getting insufficient treatment, according to a 19-state survey released Thursday.
http://www.cnn.com/2008/HEALTH/conditions/08/08/epilepsy.adults/index.html
